refsection.title: sim
refsection.para: Static arrays coming from the result of the compilation. That arrays does not evolve during the simulation.
These information are used both by the simulator and the code generator.

Type : scilab tlist of type "scs" with fields : funs, xptr, zptr, ozptr, zcptr, inpptr, outptr, inplnk, outlnk, rpar, rpptr, ipar, ipptr, opar, opptr, clkptr, ordptr, execlk, ordclk, cord, oord, zord, critev, nb, ztyp, nblk, ndcblk, subscr, funtyp, iord, labels, modptr and uids.

refsect2.title: funs
refsect2.para: A list containing names of the computational functions or scilab functions.
Type : list of strings and/or scilab function.

refsect2.title: xptr
refsect2.para: A vector pointer to the continuous time state register x. The continuous-time state of block i is state.x(sim.xptr(i):sim.xptr(i+1)-1).

refsect2.title: zptr
refsect2.para: A vector pointer to the discrete time state register z. The discrete-time state of block i is state.z(sim.zptr(i):sim.zptr(i+1)-1).

refsect2.title: ozptr
refsect2.para: A vector pointer to the object discrete state register oz. The object discrete state of block i is state.oz(sim.ozptr(i):sim.ozptr(i+1)-1).

refsect2.title: zcptr
refsect2.para: A vector pointer to the zero-crossing surfaces register. That vector gives by block the used number of the zero-crossing.

refsect2.title: inpptr
refsect2.para: (sim.inpptr(i+1)-sim.inpptr(i)) gives the number of regular input ports of the i block.
inpptr(i) points to the beginning of i th block inputs within the indirection table inplnk.

refsect2.title: outptr
refsect2.para: (sim.outptr(i+1)-sim.outptr(i)) gives the number of regular output ports of the i block.
outptr(i) points to the beginning of i th block outputs within the indirection table outlnk.

refsect2.title: inplnk
refsect2.para: (cpr.sim.inplnk(cpr.sim.inpptr(i)-1+j)) is the index of the link connected to the j th input port of the i th block where j goes from 1 to (cpr.sim.inpptr(i+1)-cpr.sim.inpptr(i)).
Size : total number of regular input port.

refsect2.title: outlnk
refsect2.para: (cpr.sim.outlnk(cpr.sim.outptr(i)-1+j)) is the index of the link connected to the j th output port of the i th block where j goes from 1 to (cpr.sim.outptr(i+1)-cpr.sim.outptr(i)).
Size : total number of regular output port.

refsect2.title: rpar
refsect2.para: Vector of real parameters that is obtained by concatenating the real parameters registers of all the blocks.
Size : total number of real parameters.
Type : column vector of real numbers.

refsect2.title: rpptr
refsect2.para: A vector pointer to the real parameters register rpar. The real parameters of block i are sim.rpar(sim.rpptr(i):sim.rpptr(i+1)-1).

refsect2.title: ipar
refsect2.para: Vector of integer parameters that is obtained by concatenating the integer parameters registers of all the blocks.
Size : total number of integer parameters.

refsect2.title: ipptr
refsect2.para: A vector pointer to the integer parameters register ipar. The integer parameters of block i are sim.ipar(sim.ipptr(i):sim.ipptr(i+1)-1).
Type : column vector of real numbers.

refsect2.title: opar
refsect2.para: List of object parameters that is obtained by concatenating the list of object parameters of all the blocks.
Size : total number of object parameters.

refsect2.title: opptr
refsect2.para: A vector pointer to the object parameters list opar. The object parameters of block i are sim.opar(sim.opptr(i):sim.opptr(i+1)-1).

refsect2.title: clkptr
refsect2.para: A vector pointer to output activation ports.
(cpr.sim.clkptr(i):cpr.sim.clkptr(i+1)-1) gives the number of output event ports of the block i.

refsect2.title: ordptr
refsect2.para: A vector pointer to ordclk designating the part of ordclk corresponding to a given activation.
(cpr.sim.ordptr(i):cpr.sim.ordptr(i+1)-1) points to the region within ordclk indicates the number of blocks activated by the output event ports numbered i.
Size : number of sources of activation + 1.

refsect2.title: ordclk
refsect2.para: A matrix associated to blocks activated by output activation ports. The first column contains the block number, and the second, the event code by which the block should be called.
Size : total number of blocks summed by source of activations.

refsect2.title: cord
refsect2.para: A matrix associated to always active blocks.
The first column contains the block number, and the second, the event code by which the block should be called.

refsect2.title: oord
refsect2.para: Subset of cord. Blocks of that matrix have outputs which affect computation of continuous state derivatives.

refsect2.title: zord
refsect2.para: Subset of oord. Blocks of that matrix have outputs which affect computation of zero-crossing surfaces.

refsect2.title: critev
refsect2.para: A vector of size equal to the number of activations and containing zeros and ones. The value 1 indicates that the activation is critical in the sense that the continuous-time solver must be cold restarted.
Size : number of source of activation.

refsect2.title: nb
refsect2.para: Number of blocks. Note that the number of blocks may differ from the original number of blocks in the diagram because c_pass2 may duplicate some conditional blocks.

refsect2.title: ztyp
refsect2.para: A vector of size equal to the number of blocks.
A 1 entry indicates that the block may have zero-crossings, even if it does not in the context of the diagram. Usually not used by the simulator.

refsect2.title: funtyp
refsect2.para: A vector of size equal to the number of blocks indicating the type of the computational function of the block. Block type can be 0 through 5.
Currently only type 4 (C language) and type 5 (Scilab language) computational functions should be used. But older blocks can also be used.

refsect2.title: iord
refsect2.para: A matrix associated to blocks that must be activated at the start of the simulation. This includes blocks inheriting from constant blocks and always active blocks.

refsect2.title: labels
refsect2.para: A string vector of size equal to the number of blocks containing block labels.

refsect2.title: modptr
refsect2.para: A vector pointer to the block modes.

refsect2.title: uids
refsect2.para: A string vector of size equal to the number of blocks containing block UIDs (each value is a unique block identifier).
